intro: Storckiella vitiensis, commonly known as the Vitiensis storckia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Vanuatu. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Storckiella vitiensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
